questions.question: What is Paradise (Jannah)?
options: A temporary reward for good deeds
The eternal home Allah prepared for believers who do righteous deeds
A state of mind achieved through meditation

questions.question: According to hadith, what has no eye seen, no ear heard, and no mind conceived?
options: The beauty and bliss of Paradise

questions.question: How can we enter Paradise according to the Prophet ﷺ?
options: By being born into a Muslim family
By Allah's mercy combined with sincere faith and good actions

questions.question: According to Qur'an 3:133, how wide is Paradise?
options: As wide as the heavens and earth
As wide as the seven seas

questions.question: What is the most common name for Paradise in the Qur'an?
What does the name 'Dar As-Salām' mean?
Which name refers to the highest Paradise?
Why does Allah use many different names for Paradise?
options: To make the Qur'an more poetic
To help us understand and desire Paradise's countless blessings

questions.question: When was Paradise created?
options: After the Day of Judgment begins
It will be created in the future

questions.question: What is Paradise's soil made of?
What are the buildings in Paradise made of?
options: Bricks of gold and silver with musk mortar

questions.question: When did the Prophet ﷺ see Paradise?
options: During his Night Journey (Isra and Mi'raj)
He never saw it in this life

questions.question: How many gates does Paradise have?
What is the name of the gate specifically for those who fasted frequently?
How wide are Paradise's gates?
options: As wide as a large door
So wide the distance between two sides equals the distance between Mecca and Busra
As wide as a city street

questions.question: Who will be called from all eight gates of Paradise?
options: Exceptional people like Abu Bakr who excelled in every type of worship

questions.question: What is the key to entering Paradise?
options: Saying 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh' with sincere belief and righteous actions
Being born into a Muslim family

questions.question: What are the 'teeth' of the key to Paradise?
options: The actions that demonstrate true belief

questions.question: Is saying 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh' alone enough to enter Paradise?
options: Yes, the words alone are sufficient
No, it must be combined with sincere belief and righteous actions

questions.question: What happens to good deeds done without faith in Allah?
options: They are stored for the afterlife
They help in this world only

questions.question: What will the person with the lowest rank in Paradise receive?
options: A kingdom ten times the size of Earth

questions.question: According to hadith, how far will the lowest person in Paradise see his kingdom?
options: As far as the eye can see

questions.question: What will Allah tell the person with the lowest rank?
options: That he barely made it to Paradise
That he has the same as what he sees and ten times more
That he must work harder in Paradise
That he will move to higher levels later

questions.question: What does the lowest rank in Paradise teach us?
options: That Paradise has levels of inequality
That we should aim for the minimum requirements
That even the weakest believers receive unimaginable blessings from Allah's generosity
That some people barely deserve Paradise

questions.question: What is the highest level of Paradise called?
Where is Firdaws located?
options: In the middle levels of Paradise

questions.question: What flows from Firdaws?
options: The four main rivers of Paradise

questions.question: What did the Prophet ﷺ teach us to ask for when asking Allah for Paradise?
What types of rivers flow in Paradise?
options: Seven different types of fruit juices

questions.question: What is special about the wine in Paradise's rivers?
options: It is forbidden like worldly wine
It is the same as worldly wine
It is delightful and does not intoxicate or cause harm

questions.question: What is the name of the Prophet Muhammad's ﷺ special river?
According to Qur'an 47:15, what quality does the milk in Paradise's rivers have?
What are Paradise's palaces built from?
options: Bricks of gold and silver with musk mortar

questions.question: How will people in lower Paradise see the palaces of higher levels?
options: They won't be able to see them
Shining like stars in the sky

questions.question: According to hadith, what earns a palace in Paradise?
What is special about some palaces in Paradise?
options: They are so transparent people can see through them

questions.question: What will the people of Paradise wear?
options: The finest silk and brocade adorned with gold and pearls
Whatever they wore in worldly life

questions.question: What will happen to clothes in Paradise?
options: They need to be washed regularly
They will never tear, wear out, or become dirty

questions.question: What will everyone's sweat smell like in Paradise?
According to Qur'an 76:21, what color garments will people wear?
options: Green garments of fine silk and brocade

questions.question: What will people eat in Paradise?
options: Whatever they desire instantly without effort

questions.question: What happens to waste from food in Paradise?
options: It leaves as pleasant-smelling sweat like musk
There is no waste at all

questions.question: According to Qur'an 56:21, what type of meat will be available?
options: Meat of fowl, from whatever they desire
Meat is not served in Paradise

questions.question: What negative effects does Paradise's food have?
options: It can make people temporarily sick
It has no negative effects at all

questions.question: Who will believers enjoy companionship with in Paradise?
options: The prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and the righteous
Only people from their own time period
They will be alone in their palaces

questions.question: What will Allah remove from people's hearts in Paradise?
According to Qur'an 15:47, how will believers sit in Paradise?
options: As brothers on thrones facing each other

questions.question: Will there be any negative emotions in Paradise?
options: No, there will be no arguments, jealousy, or hatred

questions.question: What will happen to believing families in Paradise?
options: They will be separated by their deeds
They will be reunited at the highest level achieved by any member
Children will be separate from parents

questions.question: According to Qur'an 52:21, who will be joined with believers in Paradise?
options: All their relatives regardless of faith
Their descendants who followed them in faith

questions.question: Can disbelieving family members enter Paradise?
options: Yes, if believers pray for them enough
Yes, after a long time in Hellfire
No, only those who died with faith can reunite
Yes, if they were kind people

questions.question: What should motivate us regarding family reunions in Paradise?
options: To worry about our family constantly
To guide our families toward faith and righteousness
To abandon family members who don't practice

questions.question: What are Hoor al-'Ayn?
options: Spouses of perfect beauty and character created for Paradise

questions.question: How are the Hoor al-'Ayn described?
options: As having large, beautiful eyes and radiant faces

questions.question: Will Paradise have perfect relationships?
options: No, there will be minor disagreements
Yes, relationships bring only joy without worldly problems
Relationships are not important in Paradise

questions.question: According to Qur'an 55:56, what quality do the Hoor al-'Ayn have?
options: They are pure and untouched before by man or jinn

questions.question: Why do people gather in Paradise's markets?
options: To socialize and receive gifts from Allah

questions.question: How often will people visit Paradise's markets?
What happens when people attend Paradise's markets?
options: They trade goods with each other
Winds blow carrying fragrances and increase their beauty

questions.question: What will spouses notice when people return from Paradise's markets?
options: They are even more beautiful than before
They are tired from the journey

questions.question: What age will everyone be in Paradise?
What happens to people who were sick or disabled in worldly life?
options: They will be perfectly healthy and whole

questions.question: Will people age in Paradise?
options: No, they remain at perfect age forever

questions.question: According to hadith, how will people of Paradise enter it?
options: Hairless, beardless, with eyes anointed with kohl, aged thirty or thirty-three

questions.question: What is the greatest blessing in Paradise?
How often will believers see Allah in Paradise?
options: Regularly, like gazing at the full moon

questions.question: What will happen when believers see Allah?
options: They will forget every other pleasure of Paradise
They will ask to return to their palaces

questions.question: According to Qur'an 75:22-23, what will some faces do on that Day?
options: Be radiant, looking at their Lord

questions.question: How will Allah speak to believers in Paradise?
options: Directly without any translator or barrier

questions.question: What will Allah say to greet the people of Paradise?
What will Allah ask the people of Paradise?
options: If they miss the worldly life

questions.question: According to Qur'an 36:58, what is the word from the Merciful Lord?
What will NOT exist in Paradise?
options: Death, disease, pain, sadness, or worry

questions.question: What will the announcer proclaim to the people of Paradise?
options: That they will live forever, never die, be healthy, young, and in bliss
That they can visit Earth occasionally
That they must wait for judgment

questions.question: According to Qur'an 44:56, will people taste death in Paradise?
options: No, except the first death (worldly death)

questions.question: What is one of Paradise's greatest blessings regarding time?
options: The eternal security that families stay together and joy never ends
People can travel back in time

questions.question: What determines whether our actions are leading us to Paradise?
options: Whether we pray faithfully, treat others kindly, avoid sins, and strive to please Allah

questions.question: What does the path to Paradise require?
options: Sincere faith, consistent good deeds, and repentance from sins

questions.question: According to hadith, how close is Paradise to us?
options: Very far away in the heavens
Closer than the strap of our shoe

questions.question: What should Paradise motivate us to do?
options: Live righteously and call others to the truth
